stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements best explains why the average temperature of London is warmer than that of Calgary in December?

features.html: The city of London in the United Kingdom is found approximately at the same latitude as the city of Calgary in Canada. Calgary has an average high temperature in December of âˆ’ 4.6  degrees Celsius, while London has an average high temperature of 8.6 degrees Celsius.

choicesHtml: Oceanic currents warm the atmosphere in London.
The solar radiation reaching London is more perpendicular than the solar radiation that reaches Calgary in December.
London is farther from the North Pole than Calgary is.
The Hadley cell converges over London and pushes warm air toward the surface.
